title: Introduction to Experimental Design
text:
Welcome!
This website contains materials for course CAS PS 211 at Boston University, which serves as a primer for undergraduate psychology majors in statistical and experimental methods for psychological research. The materials here are speific to Fall 2025, Section B1.
Announcements and assignments will come through Blackboard. See the links above.

Additional Resources
Students are likely to find useful the following free online resources:

R for Data Science
Hadley Wickham, Mine Çetinkaya-Rundel, and Garrett Grolemund
If this is your first time programming in R, sections of this book may aid your understanding of the language.
Answering Questions with Data
Matthew J. C. Crump, Danielle J. Navarro, and Jeffrey Suzuki
Experimentology: An Open Science Approach to Experimental Psychology Methods
Michael C. Frank, Mika Braginsky, Julie Cachia, Nicholas A. Coles, Tom E. Hardwicke, Robert D. Hawkins, Maya B. Mathur, Rondeline Williams
Introduction to Modern Statistics
Mine Çetinkaya-Rundel and Johanna Hardin
The Effect: An Introduction to Research Design and Causality
Nick Huntington-Klein
